Location: HYBRID HEARING - Council Chambers - City Hall

Items.Title: The City Clerk will call the Charter Meeting to order pursuant to Section 42 of the Charter.
Items.AgendaNote: THE CITY CLERK WILL CALL THE CHARTER MEETING TO ORDER PURSUANT TO SECTION 42 OF THE CHARTER.
Items.MinutesNote: The City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney) duly called this organizational Charter Meeting  of January 5, 2022 to order pursuant to Section 42 of the Charter..

Items.Title: The City Clerk will perform the ceremony of the duly elected Council Members taking their oath of office.
Items.AgendaNote: THE CITY CLERK WILL PERFORM THE CEREMONY OF THE DULY ELECTED COUNCIL MEMBERS TAKING THEIR OATH OF OFFICE.

Items.Title: INVOCATION
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Rev. Dr.  Elaine M. Flake, spiritual leader at The Greater Allen A.M.E. Cathedral of New York located at 110-31 Floyd H. Flake Boulevard, Jamaica, NY 11433.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Williams.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rev. Elaine M. Flake, spirtual leader at The Greater Allen  A.M.E. Cathedral of New York located at 110-31 Floyd H. Flake Boulevard, Jamaica, N.Y. 11433.

Council Member Williams moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Continuation of the 2018 to 2021 Rules of the Council as amended, and including the April 22, 2020 suspension of certain in-person requirements in light of the Covid-19 pandemic.
Items.MinutesNote: Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney) called for a voice-vote .  Hearing no objections, the City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney) declared the motion for the Continuation of the Rules to be adopted.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Continuation of 2018-2021 Rules of the Council, As Amended.

Items.Title: The City Clerk will then open the floor for nominations for the office of Speaker of the Council of the City New York pursuant to Section 44 of the New York City Charter for the term commencing January 1, 2022 and terminating December 31, 2023.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Items.Title:
At a duly convened meeting, we, the undersigned members of the Minority (Republican) Delegation of the Council of the City of New York, hereby designate and appoint Joseph C. Borelli as Minority Leader of the Council of the City of New York, pursuant to Rule 4.10 of the Rules of the Council of the City of New York for the term which commenced on January 1, 2022, effective January 5, 2022.

Signed: Joann Ariola, Joseph C. Borelli, David Carr, Vickie Paladino and Inna Vernikov
Items.MinutesNote: During this segment of the Meeting, the newly re-designated Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli) spoke briefly to those assembled.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Petition was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council

Items.Title: Designate and appoint Diana I. Ayala as Deputy Speaker of the Council of the City of New York, for the term which commenced on January 1, 2022, effective January 5, 2022.

Items.Title:
Pursuant to Rule 4.10 of the Council of the City of New York and Paragraph 5 of the Bylaws of the Minority Delegation of the same, I hereby designate and appoint Inna Vernikov as Minority Whip of the Council of the City of New York, for the term which commenced on January 1, 2022, effective January 5, 2022.

Signed: Joseph C. Borelli, Minority Leader
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Petition was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council

Items.Title: ADJOURNED
Items.MinutesNote:
The Speaker (Council Member Adams) adjourned the Charter Meeting.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

49 Council Members voted for Council Member Adams.
  2 Council Members voted in the negative.

The City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney) declared Council Member Adams as the duly elected Speaker of the New York City Council for the 2022-2023 term.
The City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) delivered the ceremonial oath of office to all 51 duly elected Council Members.
The presence of a quorum was announced by the City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney).

Council Member Brooks-Powers moved that the 2018-2021 Rules of the Council, as amended (including the April 22, 2020 suspension of certain in-person requirements in light of the COVID-19 pandemic) be continued and in effect until new rules shall be adopted or set rules shall be otherwise amended or modified.

The City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) called for a voice-vote on the motion.

At this point, Council Member Brooks-Powers nominated Council Member Adams as the next Speaker of the Council.  Council Member Brooks-Powers's motion was seconded by Council Members Ayala, Brannan, Powers, Brewer, and Moya.
At this point, the newly elected Speaker (Council Member Adams) delivered her remarks to those assembled.

The Speaker (Council Member Adams) nominated the following Council Members to be on the organizational Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections:

Council Members Brooks-Powers as Temporary Chair and Council Members Brewer, Hanks, Hudson, Joseph, Krishnan, Louis, Powers, Salamanca,Velázquez, and Won.
